content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

Happy New Year! It’s great to be back. This Week in Genesis should actually be called These Weeks in Genesis as it the best of everything I could find from my last update on 18 Dec 2016 till today.

Such as? A new theme, even more ways to level up your Genesis skills, plus some podcasts that will get you smiling (and your grey matter working).

What better way to start another year of Genesis WordPress?

Themes

A new year and a new Genesis theme already out in the world, this time from the very productive folks over at Imagely as their launch their 13th photography theme, Sidewinder (and I hear more are in the works very soon).

Sidewinder

Showcase

Ryan Townley launches a new site built on his Keeper theme for koolaw.com

Just launched this local attorney website built on #genesiswp using the @minimalgenesis Keeper theme: https://t.co/mC8vhTG1FM pic.twitter.com/CO2MRnycBR

— Ryan Townley (@ryantownley) December 22, 2016

Lemonade Stand for strongholdengineering.com

Check out the site just launched for award-winning construction firm https://t.co/bZdSYshtF2 using @WordPress / @studiopress' #genesiswp.

— Lemonade Stand (@LemonadeStnd) January 6, 2017

Pilcrow + Pixel with two new sites. First up, fisunguner.com

We recently launched a new site for art critic and arts writer @FisunGuner: https://t.co/AEhq30PMgn #genesiswp #wordpress

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) January 2, 2017

And another for lizcarr.co.uk

… & today, new site for actress, comedian, presenter & disability rights activist @thelizcarr https://t.co/dDx2SMChpK #genesiswp #wordpress

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) January 2, 2017

Tara Claeys re-launches her agency website, designtlc.com

New Website for myself

Evan Henry redesigns a 5,000 page website (and would love your feedback) for keystonepuppies.com

Keystone Puppies Redesign

Tim Marchant with a new site for leveltwo.org

New website for Christmas for @leveltwoyp #genesiswp #wordpress #felixstowe https://t.co/pqD7g0yL6q pic.twitter.com/WqWRTKhSGz

— Tim Marchant (@timmarchant) December 22, 2016

ChillyBin Web Design for asiarugby.com

A brand new #genesiswp site just went live for @asiarugby today pic.twitter.com/1e7zKpSpVO

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) December 19, 2016

Podcasts

A double dose of rethink.fm. First Jackie D’Elia chats to Cathi Bosco on collaboration, lessons learned and favourite design elements.

We're talking collaboration, lessons learned + favorite design elements w/ @bethebreeze #WordPress #GenesisWP https://t.co/uDCsH5lbg5

— Rethink FM (@rethinkfm) December 21, 2016

And then she chats to Carrie Dils (of OfficeHours.fm fame) on Genesis and her upcoming book (with Diane Kinney), Real World Freelancing.

Episode 12: Season Finale with Carrie Dils https://t.co/dZJ7sSewRV pic.twitter.com/pgN5FUhfbu

— carrie dils (@cdils) January 6, 2017

Meanwhile over on OfficeHours.fm (very meta), there’s no Carrie this week (get well soon!), but instead there’s the very capable line up of Brian Richards, Diane Kinney and Morten Rand-Hendriksen discussing the REST API and more!

In the absence of @cdils, some Pure Gold is happening on tonight’s show: https://t.co/HHEA8CRY7Y

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) January 6, 2017

Best of the rest

Know The Code opens up even more of its Genesis tutorials for free so there’s no excuse not to start levelling up you skills.

[FREE] See the #GenesisWP framework in action & then dive into its codebase in this 3 hr hands-on Overview lab https://t.co/Ipw4bgPQc5 pic.twitter.com/lqHa5HTYfU

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) December 28, 2016

Plus, they’ve lowered the price on their yearly membership from $290/year to $259/year, so if you’re looking for even knowledge, it’s a great time to go pro.

https://www.facebook.com/KnowTheCodePro/posts/1202278589859142

Omar Al-Ansari on creating a Post Grid in Genesis using Flexbox.

Create a Posts Grid in Genesis using Flexboxhttps://t.co/5sPMamr4ZX#GenesisWP #WordPress #Flexbox #CSS

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) December 22, 2016

Marcy Diaz on creating a mega menu in Genesis without a plugin.

Mega Menu Drop Down Navigation for Genesis Themes using CSS https://t.co/xQlGSAbwc0 <- No plugin needed #genesiswp

— Marcy Diaz (@mjsdiaz1) December 22, 2016

Sridhar Katakam on setting up a basic full-width widgetized homepage in Genesis…

Full Width Widgetized Front Page in Genesis:https://t.co/5hmduuNoEU#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/pWEHKu3Ox4

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) January 5, 2017

…plus, another useful one, how to add links to post comments when commenting is disabled in Genesis.

How to add link to comments when commenting is disabled for posts in Genesis:https://t.co/Ex1OW9hJnz#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/ODbP7h2KCk

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 31, 2016

The Blox builder plugin for Genesis now includes a shortcode add-on.

Excited about this new @bloxwp add-on. Greatly increases with versatility of Blox! Use #genesiswp? Check this out… https://t.co/uKn0cuSlbM

— Nick Diego (@nickmdiego) January 6, 2017

And finally…

A moment of silence for those who hardcode year in the #website footer copyright text. 2016 should be 2017 now. #genesiswp #WordPress

— Bharat Mandava (@_mandava) January 2, 2017

That’s all for this week. If you’ve got something share please add it at genesiswp.guide/add and I’ll include the best in next week’s round-up.

And if you’d like weekly highlights like this throughout 2017, come and join us at genesiswp.guide/subscribe.

Here’s to a great 2017.

excerpt.rendered: In the first round-up of 2017, there’s a new Genesis photography theme, even more free Genesis content to enjoy at Know The Code, and new tutorials to help you level up.
